explanation: I have chosen 2 litres of water per person as the most important item for our survival as dehydration in extreme desert conditions can quickly lead to physical and mental decline, jeopardizing our chances of making rational decisions and enduring the harsh environment. Water is essential for maintaining bodily functions and preventing heat-related illnesses, ensuring our well-being and survival until rescue arrives. Prioritizing hydration is critical in maximizing our resilience and increasing our likelihood of making it through this challenging ordeal.
